job_title: Vice President of Marketing and Development
job_description:
DePaul Community Resources is seeking a Vice President
of Marketing & Development.

We invite experienced marketing and development professionals to
join our dynamic team and contribute to our mission of making a
positive impact in the community. If you possess the skills and
vision to lead our marketing and development initiatives, we
encourage you to apply and be a key part of our organization's
growth and success. This position may work out of any DePaul
office location in Virginia.

The desired candidate should have:

Proven expertise in executing special events, board member
stewardship, strategic plan development, donor cultivation, and
executive team leadership. Demonstrated success in supervisory or
managerial roles overseeing marketing and development teams, with a
comprehensive understanding of marketing budgets and their
application in the non-profit sector.

About DePaul
Community
Resources:

For 47 years, DePaul Community Resources has opened doors to
hope and belonging for families and individuals across Central and
Southwest Virginia. As a social impact organization, DePaul strives
every day to change the world by improving the lives of children,
families, and individuals with developmental disabilities.

DePaul exists to address the gaps where resources are lacking to
improve the quality of life of these individuals. Its Child and
Family Services (CFS) division provides foster care, independent
living, outpatient counseling, and adoption to prepare foster
children and adoptive families with the services and support
necessary for each waiting child to find a permanent, forever
home.

The Developmental Disabilities Division is committed to
increasing self-sufficiency and promoting the growth of individuals
throughout their lives (not just when they were young) through
sponsored residential programs and the new agency directed services
program. Two daytime support centers not only provide relief and a
critical resource for families who have loved ones with
developmental disabilities but also allow the individuals to
integrate and engage with others, elevating the significance of
their dignity and worth.

Through two service divisions and eleven service locations
throughout the state of Virginia — Child and Family Services and
Developmental Disabilities, 150 staff, a network of nearly 400 care
providers, foster and adoptive parents, and a host of volunteers,
advocates, and partners, DePaul provides safe homes, permanent
families, integrated community support, and opportunities for deep
healing across Virginia.

JOB SUMMARY:

The Vice President of Marketing and Development is a member of
the Executive Leadership team and leads the agency in marketing,
external communications, public relations, community events, and
legislative advocacy and grows the organization's capacity through
development strategies and home-finding efforts. The Vice President
of Marketing and Development leads, guides, and directs all major
external engagement areas as assigned by the Chief Executive
Officer (CEO/President). This person must effectively represent the
organization in the community, build relationships, and work
collaboratively in all settings.

SUPERVISION RECEIVED AND EXERCISED:

The Vice President of Marketing and Development supervises the
Director of Development, the Director of Marketing, and an
Administrative Assistant and reports directly to the
CEO/President.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES:

This list is not an exhaustive & all-inclusive list of job
responsibilities. The distribution of time allotted for any
function or duty is subject to change with or without notice.
Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to
assign other responsibilities to this job or reassign them
elsewhere at any time.

PLANNING:
• Lead, guide, delegate, and direct all major areas of marketing:
public and media relations, communication, branding, community
events, legislative advocacy, and recruitment of foster care and
sponsored residential homes
• Lead, guide, and direct all major areas of development:
research and prospect identification, cultivation and communication
strategies, solicitation strategies, grant writing, donor
stewardship, database management, communications and outreach
activities, and development-related volunteer relations
• Ensure the organization is represented well, establish and
maintain good relationships with our media and communication
partners
• Work with division and organization leadership teams to
identify specific areas of advocacy, marketing, and development
needs
• Provide leadership, supervision, and oversight for marketing
and development staff and work collaboratively with all departments
on organizational projects
• Develop and adhere to an annual marketing and development
budget to ensure proper use of the organization's funds in a
cost-effective, sustainable manner
• Serve as an exemplary advocate for DePaul in the community with
local leaders, religious organizations, business and corporate
partnerships, and other leaders, and build relationships that
closely link the community to the organization
• Ensure open communication to create a community, inform and
reinforce values and connections, and promote a greater
understanding of DePaul's services, standing in the community, and
fiscal sustainability
• Ensure effective methods of communication with stakeholders,
designing regular, meaningful interactions both in and outside the
organization
• Engage external stakeholders, coordinate marketing,
fundraising, social media, and signature event projects that
support the mission, build brand recognition or community awareness
of DePaul, and increase alternate revenue streams while remaining
attentive to an assigned budget

TEAM DEVELOPMENT AND LEADERSHIP:
• Hire, supervise, and ensure professional development (high
performance and continuous improvement for all marketing and
development staff and develop a commitment to quality, customer
service, and teamwork within the marketing and development
departments

OPERATIONS:
• Ensure alignment of strategic and tactical operations within
the department and serve as an active and contributing member of
the Executive Leadership team
• Ensure accountability to results through regular monitoring and
reporting of department data
• Achieve financial objectives by preparing the annual budget,
scheduling expenditures, analyzing variances, and estimating return
on investment or ROI
• Coordinate media and legislative interests in the organization
and ensure regular contact with target audiences

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS TO APPLY:

A bachelor’s degree with five years of demonstrated excellence
in supervising and leading in marketing, public and media
relations, communications, strategic plan development, special
events, fundraising, grant writing, and donor cultivation is
required. Experience with board stewardship and creating and
managing budgets in the non-profit sector is desirable.
